A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: As a person who didn't watch Star War until college\, my review is perhaps fairer without strong expectations of a long time fan. However\, my conclusion is\, this movie is seriously bad. Regardless all the factors of legacy and fandom\, this movies storytelling technique would probably get a F from any college storytelling class. The entire plot has very few cohesion. From the attack\, chase\, Vegas to final stand\, the story felt apart as separate pieces. For a moment\, it almost like playing different sections of a videogame.\nIt is okay to step away from the original Star War and try something new\, but I think the writer of this movie still portrait the personality of most of the characters very badly. The personalities are inconsistent and does not make sense. I don't think this has anything to do with the original sequel. The writer is incapable of handling a large story like this.
